Most Illustrious and Most Excellent Sir

Certainly Your Excellency Colonel Lebério must be destined to receive your orders, and as I understand that perhaps the government is about to take action, for this reason I await from Your Excellency Your Excellency Your Excellency

I had written to you from São Gabriel regarding the same matter, whose letter is in the possession of the wife of compadre José Mariano and, were it not for the reasons that occurred, certainly I would not have taken such a step without the deliberation of Your Excellency

The health of Your Excellency

From Your Excellency’s very grateful friend Antônio José de Abreu

Nota Bene Your Excellency

Most Illustrious and Most Excellent Sir Domingos José de Almeida . Alegrete .

Received and answered on August 28, 1840 .
